instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP3V3_S5_REG: What is PP3V3_S5_REG? PP3V3_S5_REG is a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H_REG: What is PP3V42_G3H_REG? PP3V42_G3H_REG is another way to say PP3V42_G3H. PP3V42_G3H_REG and PP3V42_G3H are a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.message:
not turn on, orange light
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H_REG</SIGNAL>=3.42

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>=oscilacion voltage

todas las demas fuentes bobinas oscila voltage
no hay corto en ninguna bobina
no historia disponible
modo bypass persiste problema

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> b
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> b
threads.message:
yes, vcore pulsing
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> a small pulse

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> b
threads.message:
Check for voltage pulse (or short to ground) at all voltage rails from pages 11, 55, 56.
Also check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.

Be sure to get pulse at <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>/pin 3.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> b
threads.message: ok esta bien voy a medir, una pregunta el cristal Y1905, deberia siempre oscilar asi sea que no empieze a girar el ventilador( o sea antes del pulso del power)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> b
threads.message: Y1905 is not included in power on sequence.
